pros: Within the admissions and financial aid offices, as well as the office of the VP (the overhead for both), there was high work ethic, strong sense of duty to the university and to each other.
cons: The pros come with a bit of kool-aid drinking, but if you're looking for others who are committed to the cause you're working towards, then this is good.

pros: Flexible schedule, friendly staff, although they pick favorites.

review_title: A Good Place to Gain Experience
pros: Great location, on-site parking, supportive coworkers, tuition assistance, health insurance
cons: Support for research is lacking, college looks out more for their bottom line than anything else, non-pharmacy programs are often ignored

job_title: Senior Assistant Director of Transfer Admissions in Albany, NY
pros: A small campus community allows you to work across different departments on a college campus. It increases your knowledge in different areas while expanding your knowledge in your primary role.
cons: Limited amount of advancement for employees looking to advance their career in higher education. As a health science school, many faculty members are Doctor's or health professionals and are the decision makers within their specific departments. I am not sure that they have the expertise or knowledge to make higher education business decisions with their backgrounds.

review_title: Good Place to work if you are in Academia in Albany
pros: Flexibility with scheduling your class load, generally friendly and helpful admins, many non compensatory benefits such as tuition remission for employees and dependents. New President this year is faculty oriented.
cons: Unless you are tenure track, no career development, very few professional development opportunities, no mentoring for new faculty, no advising mentoring. School of Pharmacy is top heavy with Directors, and admins.

pros: The benefits are good, but not as good as they used to be.
cons:
Toxic work environment from end-to-end. My boss repeatedly scheduled early morning meetings, showed up late and never apologized. The same boss who questioned to my face whether I deserved my salary. The same boss who let my coworkers have business equipment (phones, monitors, business cards), but would not allow me to have the same things.

Dozens of people who work or worked there question President Dewey's leadership. Faculty make little collective effort to treat non-faculty with respect.

pros: Nice environment, low stress, pretty campus
cons: Limited resources, focused on graduating pharmacists and not research

pros: Good benefits and 401K. Amazing students, faculty & staff.
cons: Not big on change, stuck in a "this is the way we've always done it" mentality. Need to be more forward thinking.

review_title: Best Place to Work, Study and Live!!!!
